block.p: Ashley Gale Marsh, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. and Scott Marsh III of New Vernon, N.J., was married yesterday to Dr. David Stephen Pertsemlidis, a son of Lois Pertsemlidis and Dr. Demetrius Pertsemlidis of Manhattan. Judge Kenneth C. MacKenzie of New Jersey Superior Court in Morristown performed the ceremony at the Somerset Hills Country Club in Bernardsville, N.J.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a Bronx assistant district attorney. This month, she is to begin as a law clerk to Judge Arthur D. Spatt of Federal District Court for the Eastern District of New York, in Central Islip. She graduated from Princeton University and received a law degree from American University. Her father is a consultant at the Beacon Trust Company, a portfolio managment concern in Chatham, N.J. Her mother, Betty Marsh, is a trustee of the Newark Museum and Drew University and a founder of New Jersey Seeds, which helps prepare poor students for independent secondary schools.

His mother performed as a classical pianist under the name Lois Whiteman. His father is a clinical professor of surgery at Mount Sinai School of Medicine in Manhattan.
